<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Wolf in Sheep's Clothing](/Feats.aspx?ID=3762) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Ranger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=136" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 64</row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5)

</column>

---

With a bit of hide, some antlers, and some cast-off fur, you can create a disguise that will fool even an experienced hunter. You can [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) creatures with the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9), [beast](/Traits.aspx?ID=20), or [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125) traits, so long as they are either the same size or one size larger than you and have a body shape that conforms at least vaguely to your own (in other words, a typical humanoid could Impersonate a [bear](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=13) or an [arboreal](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=8), but not a [horse](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=62), [giant scorpion](/Monsters.aspx?ID=356), or [assassin vine](/Monsters.aspx?ID=555)). Impersonating a larger creature doesn't change your actual size.
name: Wolf in Sheep's Clothing
